name: Marxism: From Theory to Revolution
description: From the Communist Manifesto to the fall of the Berlin Wall — how Marx's critique of capitalism inspired revolutions, produced tyrannies, and refuses to die

name: Liberalism: Freedom and Its Discontents
description: From Locke's natural rights to Rawls's veil of ignorance — the political philosophy that built the modern world and now struggles to defend it

name: Conservatism: Tradition, Order, and Change
description: From Burke's defense of tradition to Trump's populist nationalism — the philosophy that insists human societies are fragile and radical change destroys more than it creates

name: Anarchism: The Politics of No Rulers
description: From Proudhon's 'property is theft' to Rojava's democratic confederalism — the tradition that demands every hierarchy justify itself or be dismantled

name: Fascism and Authoritarianism: The Anatomy of Tyranny
description: From Mussolini's March on Rome to Putin's digital autocracy — how tyranny works, why people accept it, and what stops it

name: Postcolonial Political Thought: Power, Identity, and Liberation
description: From Fanon's decolonization to Spivak's subaltern — the thinkers who exposed how Western political philosophy was built on the exclusion of most of humanity

name: Democracy: Theory, Practice, and Crisis
description: From the Athenian Assembly to January 6 — the radical experiment in self-government that keeps almost failing and keeps being the best option we have
